title: Liburan ke Medan

text:
Untuk menginap di hotel, khususnya bintang 4. Ini adalah pengalaman terburuk saya. 
Saat itu tanggal 27 Oktober 2018, saya menginap di hotel tsb, saya memesan melalui aplikasi online dengan tipe kamar deluxe. Saat check-in saya meminta kamar dengan single bed, dikarenakan pada saat pemesanan di aplikasi tidak dapat memilih yg single atau twin. Namun petugas frontliner tsb mengatakan full untuk yg single bed dan terjadi perdebatan, setelah saya cek di online kamar masih available. 

Saya juga tidak keberatan untuk downgrade, asalkan single bed. Namun petugas tetap memaksa saya untuk tetap memberikan di twin bed. 
Setelah saya cek. Kamar dengan tempat tidur yang sempit yg saya dapatkan. 
Mulai dari kamar yang sempit, toilet nya juga sempit, warna air yang keruh/ tidak bening, serta pelayanan yg kurang tanggap dan tidak menunjukkan pelayanan bintang 4. 
Lampu di kamar mandi juga tidak terang, seperti lampu senter. 
Kualitas untuk aminities nya juga kurang baik, tidak standar bintang 4. 

Untuk dari variasi makanan yg disediakam hanya standard saja, dan rasanya juga biasa saja. 
Saat saya checkout, kondisi hari itu hujan, saat saya dari lobby menuju parkiran saya kehujanan karena tidak ada diberikan payung oleh petugas. 

Hotel yang katanya bintang 4, namun kualitas servis nya serasa hotel bintang 2. 

Saya kecewa, sebaiknya rate bintang 4 nya dicopot dan sepatutnya di review ulang.
title: No Recomended

text:

2. Tidak berisik, Kedap suara
3. Dekat sekali dengan ucok durian 
4. Sarapan cukup baik.

Kesimpulan, don't expect to much. Hotel Lumayan bagus, hanya jangan terkecoh dengan tittle bintang nya.

Cm diam aja...hehehe.. mungkin karena masi training ya.  Kamarnya... mnrt saya si kurang ok. Masuk pertama, sprei aga jorok, tatakan ranjang, banyak debu dan kotoran" spt remah". Lantai masi berdebu. Lampu kamar mandi remang"

This is a great hotel,Really impressed

CONs:

Our room wasn't ready at 2pm to check in which was disappointing after arriving at 8am.

Room had no fridge even though it says in room mini bar on information in the room.

Hotel doesn't sell any alcohol.

Not a reflection on the hotel but 2 guys on a motor bike opposite the hotel tired to steal my bag and dragged me into the gutter and hotel staff were not concerned and shrugged it off even though I was clearly shaken.

Breakfast was a good mix of Indonesian food with small selection of western.

Hotel staff were ok but didn't go out of their way to assist westerns due mainly to the lack of English.

Hotel doesn't live up to it's 'chain' name and standard. You need to lift your game!

I would stay again if I had to but would look at Sheraton Four Point up the road for a little more $$.

text:
During my visit to Medan 7&8 of June, I tried Swissbell Inn Gajah Mada, Hotel are clean quite good choices for travels, because of the cleanliness, reasonably price and good breakfast. The combination of that 3 makes its hard to ignore if the location is good as well. You basically know what you expect  when you stay at Swissbell Inn Hotel

Location - great spot in all the right places - is being right in the middle of the Medan. The only flaw is that it doesn't have right name of Swissbell Inn Gajah Mada for online transportation map such as Grab car or bike or even in Google Map, instead of it shown the old hotel name which is  Saka premier.

Price - reasonable and competitive as I book led thru TA

Check In - Arrived to a semi crowded lobby, room was not ready as I came earlier however only 15 minitues awaits time. Check out time was provide by "Cut" where i asked for another hours (1 hours extended) she was very pleasant

Room - Room  was double bedded (couldn't find any information about room size but probably around 20SqM), basic but very clean, and bathroom adequately sized with basic toiletries available. 

Breakfast - this being a breakfast inclusive package they offer and it was very busy Selection was better than I thought on the first day was abit slow refilling and second day food refill was different from previous dish 
Restaurant staff are courtesious, speed of service was good specially with black and white uniform 

Facilities - Managed to check out their alfresco gym located on level 9- its more adequate than I thought and a good 45 mins was spent here killing those damn calories. Pool - on the roof top with Medan overlooking sky was a nice place to relaxed and get some sweat

Service - Nothing to complain about and polite efficiency all round. Room.Attandent at 5th floor was doing good (i miss the chance to ask his name) 
Internet connection Wi-fi just a bit slow

In summary, I would definitely recommend this property for tourists or event for family looking for a spot to park themselves right in the middle of the action. No surprises and breakfast and facilities are sometimes the only things you need when you travel.

Regards 
Zulu Ginting
title: Affordable Price and Good Stay

text:
Stayed here on Dec 22-23rd, 2018, with family.
Drawbacks: 
- There was not enough light in the corridor of our room. 
- We obtained a smoking room, which is personally uncomfortable since we have children with us. 
- There is a TV in the room, but the channel options were limited, and the picture quality was poor.
- The bathroom is ok, but the basin was less clean and the towels were old with a stain on it (gross). 
- The shower has no curtain nor door, causing the water splashing out to the entire bathroom floor. 
- Also, there is only one pair of slipper available in the room (should've been two pairs, no?). 
- The other bad thing in our experience was that we didn't get a parking lot since they were being reserved for an event at that time (so crowded). Instead, the security suggested us to park (and pay) in front/side of the mini market (which is right across the street). Further, he even suggested us to consign the car key to the reception (or him), and then they will help to park the car in the parking ground once the event is over (we choose to wait and find the parking lot our self, tho).

Advantages:
- The building looks new and easily accessed. 
- The room is quite spacious with fair facilities. 
- The best thing of the hotel is the breakfast, it's delicious! 
- The staffs are friendly and helpful. 
- The swimming pool (9th floor) was good and the safety guard was very nice. 
- They also have a gym before the swimming pool, but we didn't use it.
- There are snack stores (Indomaret and Alfamart) across the street.

Overall, it's a so-so experience for us. We have to think twice if we want to stay here again. I think the hotel can improve more on the aforementioned points.
title: Could've been better

text:
We stayed here for a couple of nights while we recovered from food poisoning and it was such a nice haven from the grime of Medan.

The room was super clean; the staff were all so lovely, particularly the manager who sent over some tea and cakes while we waited in the lobby for a couple of hours before our onward transfer; the upstairs pool is nice!

Breakfast could be improved, as we constantly had to ask for things to be refilled - from bread for the toaster to the cutlery tray! Quite a wide selection though, which in all honesty we couldn’t sample because we felt so poorly.

Unfortunately the hotel lobby smells of cigarette smoke sometimes because of the smoking room at one end. Not nice.

Everything else was great and I would highly recommend.
title: Super clean room; lovely staff!

text: When you see the word Premiere, what comes to your mind are fancy things, shocking things and, of course, satisfying. For me, if a place or facility or brand uses the word Premium, they should be very confident with what they offer. The choice is only two, very satisfying or very disappointing. Unfortunately, I am not from a group of people who feel very satisfied. For me, this hotel is not trying too hard to be the Premiere. I stay in a Suite room, and all I get from this room is just the larger room size. There is no more facilities in it, a part of the room that turns out to be a "wardrobe", which I just realized was just because there was a place to hang clothes, a bathroom without a hair dryer, curtains that were too long and, worst of all, Air Conditioner thats too small for a large room. One thing that saved all that stuff was the pool and the interesting view of downtown Medan. I have to give compliment to this pool, but rest, not too Premiere.
title: Not too Premiere

text:
This is a new hotel. We came across this hotel while we were driving around in Medan. There was nothing Premiere about this hotel and the 4 stars below the hotel name must be for decorations only. 

We stayed for one night in their SUITE room (Pusaka Suite) just to try it out with the initial intention of extending our stay. We paid IDR 650,000 plus deposit IDR 200,000. 

For IDR 650,000 we could get a Deluxe room in Santika PREMIER Dyandra with a nice swimming pool, a very good breakfast and super fast WIFI.

Location: Located in Jalan Gajah Mada, a very busy street with lots of honking. There were 2 minimarts in front of the hotel. Pusaka Suite was on the 7th level, facing those 2 minimarts.

Room: The Pusaka suite was a big room with one big bed and 2 sofas. There was no minibar, no safe box, no hair dryer, no hand towels and no room service menu which all were required in a 4-Star hotel. The aircon was good as it's brand new. The bed and sofas were comfy. The TV was terrible, however, as the signal was very bad you couldn't see a thing. Notified the hotel and 2 guys came up and said they couldn't do anything as they're still working on the antenna reception. So watching TV was out of our to do list. The wifi was reasonably good though and the towels were good too.

Swimming Pool: It was on the 9th floor. I took a picture of the pool in the daylight (on the check-out morning) just to see how bad it was. The bottom and all the 4 walls of the pool were sickly green with algae. We were sure that they should just put some fish and ducks into it and changed the swimming pool sign into the duck pond sign. We wouldn't dare to put one toe into the water. Our daughter was really upset and disappointed that she couldn't swim. 

We felt deceived by the hotel as I have rung them previously to ask if the swimming pool could be used and being told it was swimmable. I confirmed with the check-in reception about the pool and he said the same thing that it was swimmable. The hotel management should have told the guests that the swimming pool was not ready, and leave it to the guests to decide if they still wanted to book or not, instead of telling lies. This is not a good start for a new hotel as I would never recommend anyone to stay in Saka Hotel Premiere. 

Breakfast: We came down to breakfast at 9am (breakfast hours were 6-10am). Breakfast was a horrible experience. There were rice, fried rice, fried noodle, some fish in chili sauce, sauteed vegetables, porridge, orange syrup, infused water, coffee, tea and some fruits. They definitely only catered for locals and thus, not suitable for westerners as they did not provide bread, cereal, milk, jams, cheese, butter or juice. They had the toaster out but they did not have any bread and when I asked THREE of the breakfast staff, including one reception guy, they said sheepishly that the bread was gone (They could not be bothered to go across the street to the minimarts and buy some bread, butter and jam). In the end, we just ordered breakfast delivery from McDonald.

We were very disappointed when we left and of course, would never come back and would never recommend it to anyone. This hotel could be a more decent one if they were honest about the swimming pool, improve the breakfast quality and train their staff properly. But that is too much to ask, isn't that?
title: Haven't found any hotel worse than this one
